## Elliptical Galaxies (E0-E7)

- Sphere to football shaped
- Old, red stars
- Little gas/dust
- No ongoing star formation
- Range: Dwarf to giant

## Irregular Galaxies

- No defined shape
- Often from collisions
- Active star formation

# The Big Bang Theory ðŸ’¥

## Not an Explosion INTO Space

The Big Bang was the creation of space itself!

```
Before: No space, no time
    â†“
Big Bang: Space begins expanding
    â†“
Now: Space still expanding
```

## Timeline

| Time | Event |
|------|-------|
| 0 | Singularity - infinite density |
| 10â»â´Â³ s | Planck era (physics unknown) |
| 10â»Â³â¶ s | Inflation (rapid expansion) |
| 10â»â¶ s | Quarks form protons/neutrons |
| 3 min | Nucleosynthesis (H, He, Li) |
| 380,000 yr | Atoms form, CMB released |
| 200 million yr | First stars |
| 13.8 billion yr | Today |

## Evidence for the Big Bang

### 1. Cosmic Microwave Background
- Leftover heat from early universe
- Observed by Penzias & Wilson (1964)

### 2. Hubble's Law (Expanding Universe)
```
v = Hâ‚€ Ã— d

Farther galaxies â†’ Moving away faster
```

### 3. Primordial Abundances
- 75% H, 25% He (by mass)
- Matches Big Bang predictions

### 4. Formation of Structure
- Galaxies evolved over time
- We see younger galaxies further away

## What the Big Bang ISN'T

- NOT an explosion into existing space
- NOT from a single point in space (happened everywhere)
- NOT the

of the universe

slides.title: Cosmic Microwave Background
slides.content:
# Cosmic Microwave Background (CMB) ðŸ“¡

## What is the CMB?

The "afterglow" of the Big Bang - the oldest light we can see.

## Why 380,000 Years?

```
Before 380,000 years:
- Universe too hot
- Electrons free, scattered light
- Universe was opaque

At 380,000 years:
- Cooled to ~3,000 K
- Electrons joined nuclei (recombination)
- Light could travel freely!
- Universe became transparent
```

## CMB Properties

| Property | Value |
|----------|-------|
| Current temperature | 2.725 K |
| Original temperature | ~3,000 K |
| Wavelength | Microwave |
| Uniformity | 99.999% same |

## Why So Cold Now?

```
Space expanded â†’ Light "stretched" â†’ Wavelength longer â†’ Temperature lower

3,000 K â†’ 2.725 K (1,100Ã— stretching)
```

## CMB Anisotropies

Tiny variations (~0.001Â°) in CMB temperature.

```
    Slightly warmer â”€â”€â”€â”€â†’ More matter â”€â”€â”€â”€â†’ Galaxies formed
    Slightly cooler â”€â”€â”€â”€â†’ Less matter â”€â”€â”€â”€â†’ Voids
```

## COBE, WMAP, Planck

| Satellite | Year | Achievement |
|-----------|------|-------------|
| COBE | 1992 | First detection of variations |
| WMAP | 2003 | Detailed map |
| Planck | 2013 | Precise measurements |

> ðŸ’¡ **Key Point:** CMB proves the universe was once hot, dense, and opaque!


We can only see 5% of the universe!

## Dark Matter ðŸ”®

### Evidence

**Galaxy rotation curves:**
```
Expected:  Velocity decreases outward (like planets)
Observed:  Velocity stays constant

â†’ Must be invisible mass providing gravity
```

**Gravitational lensing:**
- Light bends around invisible mass
- We can map dark matter distribution

### Properties

- Has mass (gravity)
- Does NOT emit light
- Does NOT interact with light
- ~85% of all matter
- Unknown composition (WIMPs? Axions?)

## Dark Energy âš¡

### Discovery (1998)

Type Ia supernovae were dimmer than expected.
â†’ Universe is accelerating!

### What it Does

```
Gravity: Pulls things together
Dark energy: Pushes things apart (stronger at large scales)
```

### Properties

- Causes accelerating expansion
- ~68% of universe
- Completely unknown nature
- Cosmological constant? Quintessence?

> ðŸŽ¯ **Key Point:** 95% of the universe is invisible to us!
